page.title: 05THE GARDEN CENTRE.
page.content: { Natland Garden Centre}occupies six acres but when it was started in 1936 it was contained within a back garden. There are now four full-time employees and six part-timers (who work when the seasons allow), together with the two brothers who own the business. The busiest time of year is during March and June, but in the Winter it is fairly quiet. In the Summer, plants need watering once or even twice a day, most taking between three or four months before they reach maturity. Plants are sold as far afield as {Penrith, Kirby Lonsdale}and{Kendal {markets,}while celebrities such as M.P.s and the cast of 'Coronation Street' often call to the Centre to buy them. The most popular plants are {lobelias}and{French marigolds.
